intro: Daucus pusillus var. microphyllus, commonly known as the dwarf cow parsley, is a small herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-20 cm, making it one of the smallest members of the genus Daucus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its small size and delicate appearance make it a unique and easily overlooked member of the umbelliferous family.
